Comment: Race for his seat on the D side is between Rep. Raja Krishnamoorthi, who has like $21M in the bank for a Senate run, Rep. Lauren Underwood, and Lt. Gov Julianna Stratton. Krishnamoorthi's money will be very influential, but Stratton has telegraphed that Gov Pritzker plans to back her financially (though still subject to campaign contribution limits). Underwood's fundraising last quarter was sufficient for a House run but didn't really ramp up in anticipation for a Senate run, though Durbin may prefer her as his successor.

Comment: Good riddance.   That's the last of the Vichy Democrats who would have been up for reëlection next year to announce retirement. There are still six Democrats who voted for the House continuing resolution that haven't given up.   Catherine Cortez Masto (NV), Maggie Hassan (NH), John Fetterman (PA), Brian Schatz (HI), Chuck Schumer (NY), and Kirsten Gillibrand (NY). All except the last are up for reëlection in 2028.
